subs.text: This is only the second time I've heard the Star Spangled Banner done in a non-atrocious way. It's an awful song, but Huey Lewis makes it sound great. The other time was James Taylor at a Boston Red Sox world series game. [link]
subs.rawText:
This is only the second time I've heard the Star Spangled Banner done in a non-atrocious way. It's an awful song, but Huey Lewis makes it sound great.

The other time was James Taylor at a Boston Red Sox world series game. https://t.co/cqIvebcuT9

subs.text: 1/4 There was a time when all the rivers in NY were polluted. When every apartment building had a furnace where they burned all the garbage.
subs.rawText: 1/4 There was a time when all the rivers in NY were polluted. When every apartment building had a furnace where they burned all the garbage.

subs.text: 2/4 I remember walking to school in second grade, scrubbed clean by my mother, with soot falling in my hair on my clothes.
subs.rawText: 2/4 I remember walking to school in second grade, scrubbed clean by my mother, with soot falling in my hair on my clothes.

subs.text: 3/4 But then we decided this was no way to live, and we cleaned up our act. We stopped dumping waste into the rivers and air.
subs.rawText: 3/4 But then we decided this was no way to live, and we cleaned up our act. We stopped dumping waste into the rivers and air.

subs.text: 4/4 The point is when we decide to fix something we can.
subs.rawText: 4/4 The point is when we decide to fix something we can.

subs.text:
I've been saying this a different way.

We as citizens have been protesting.

That's wrong. We must be demanding.

Look where protesting got us.

Our politicians, both parties, have forgotten they are responsible to us.

Or more appropriately, we have forgotten.
subs.rawText:
I've been saying this a different way.

We as citizens have been protesting.

That's wrong. We must be demanding.

Look where protesting got us.

Our politicians, both parties, have forgotten they are responsible to us.

Or more appropriately, we have forgotten.

subs.text:
It's like going to the doctor, and they say okay we have to switch strategies from preventing to mitigating. 

In other words you now have the disease we've been trying to prevent.

In Ohio they have a law that makes abortion illegal, now. Not in the future. Today. July 4, 2022.
subs.rawText:
It's like going to the doctor, and they say okay we have to switch strategies from preventing to mitigating. 

In other words you now have the disease we've been trying to prevent.

In Ohio they have a law that makes abortion illegal, now. Not in the future. Today. July 4, 2022.

subs.text:
In other words, we have the disease. 

We waited too long.

We didn't listen to the doctor.
subs.rawText:
In other words, we have the disease. 

We waited too long.

We didn't listen to the doctor.

subs.text:
I look at what's happening in Ukraine, the Russians destroying cities just for the hell of it.

How far are we from having that happen everywhere?

How far from having it happen here?
subs.rawText:
I look at what's happening in Ukraine, the Russians destroying cities just for the hell of it.

How far are we from having that happen everywhere?

How far from having it happen here?

subs.text:
But wait, it's even worse than that.

They are preventing Ukraine's wheat from reaching the world. We will see the results of that soon.

So it's not just Ukraine that they're destroying. 

Now come on connect the dots.

Trump is Russia. The Repubs are Russia.
subs.rawText:
But wait, it's even worse than that.

Now come on connect the dots.

Trump is Russia. The Repubs are Russia.

subs.text: Here's the nightmare. The police are Russia too.
subs.rawText: Here's the nightmare. The police are Russia too.

subs.text: We're funding our enemy right now. Arming them. Giving them everything they ask for.
subs.rawText: We're funding our enemy right now. Arming them. Giving them everything they ask for.

subs.text: The nightmare is that an awful lot of our military thinks Trump was just right.
subs.rawText: The nightmare is that an awful lot of our military thinks Trump was just right.

subs.text: And we protest.
subs.rawText: And we protest.

subs.text: Protest is pointless unless it leads to something.

subs.text:
I've never thought I'd get any insights from drawing graph-like pictures of my outlines. 

I work fast. My outlines are snapshots of what I'm doing in projects on a day by day basis.

Others are about communicating with others (reviewers, testers).
subs.rawText:
I've never thought I'd get any insights from drawing graph-like pictures of my outlines. 

I work fast. My outlines are snapshots of what I'm doing in projects on a day by day basis.

Others are about communicating with others (reviewers, testers).

subs.text: Next up the ladder are blog posts. Those are indexed by my outline indexer, daytona. And of course google et al, which care less and less about my public writing, so fuck em.
subs.rawText: Next up the ladder are blog posts. Those are indexed by my outline indexer, daytona. And of course google et al, which care less and less about my public writing, so fuck em.

subs.text: Finally is the book I've never written which will be a concordance of all the blog writing, w the most intelligent and witty parts up front. If you come up with software for that, I'm a customer. And I don't say that sarcastically, I bet google could do it, if they wanted to.
subs.rawText: Finally is the book I've never written which will be a concordance of all the blog writing, w the most intelligent and witty parts up front. If you come up with software for that, I'm a customer. And I don't say that sarcastically, I bet google could do it, if they wanted to.

subs.text: PS: I forgot to mention twitter which is for public communication of early drafts of stuff that will go on my blog after i've written it here 5 or 10 times. :-)
subs.rawText: PS: I forgot to mention twitter which is for public communication of early drafts of stuff that will go on my blog after i've written it here 5 or 10 times. :-)

subs.text: PPS: I've given up on posting serious shit on FB. Friends I care about post snarky jokes on serious stuff, and that's not fun. FB is for fun only not thought.

subs.text: @kidehen i imagine it'd be different where you are -- but here's what i'm thinking. you try to go to your bank website and you get an error. you try to call someone and there's no dial tone. you check your email but the service isn't there. you search google but it doesn't respond.
subs.rawText: @kidehen i imagine it'd be different where you are -- but here's what i'm thinking. you try to go to your bank website and you get an error. you try to call someone and there's no dial tone. you check your email but the service isn't there. you search google but it doesn't respond.

subs.text: @kidehen i've been programming for almost 50 years. i've seen big outages, i've even caused a few via programming errors. but i don't think anyone anywhere has experienced what i described (unless of course your net connection goes down, but that's not what I'm talking about).
subs.rawText: @kidehen i've been programming for almost 50 years. i've seen big outages, i've even caused a few via programming errors. but i don't think anyone anywhere has experienced what i described (unless of course your net connection goes down, but that's not what I'm talking about).

subs.text: The problem with the Supreme Court decision is that while the constitution doesn’t specifically name abortion as a right, in order to implement a ban on abortion a state will have to violate all kinds of other rights that are specifically mentioned.
subs.rawText: The problem with the Supreme Court decision is that while the constitution doesn’t specifically name abortion as a right, in order to implement a ban on abortion a state will have to violate all kinds of other rights that are specifically mentioned.

subs.text: That’s just starting to come up in discussions here and elsewhere. It’s why they should have thought this through before issuing their edict.
subs.rawText: That’s just starting to come up in discussions here and elsewhere. It’s why they should have thought this through before issuing their edict.

subs.text: BTW, you die in the surgery to remove your kidney, too bad, that’s the way it goes.

subs.text: One of the reasons I block people who make trollish comments to things I write is to deprive them of the ability to do it again. Twitter quietly introduced another feature, short of blocking, that does it softly. You can cause someone to unfollow you. They are not notified.
subs.rawText: One of the reasons I block people who make trollish comments to things I write is to deprive them of the ability to do it again. Twitter quietly introduced another feature, short of blocking, that does it softly. You can cause someone to unfollow you. They are not notified.

subs.text: Will we come to despise Christianity in the US?
subs.rawText: Will we come to despise Christianity in the US?

subs.text: I asked this question because up to this last week I felt that Christianity was other people’s problem, not mine. But they’ve captured the Supreme Court, and they’re using it to force their religion on the rest of us.
subs.rawText: I asked this question because up to this last week I felt that Christianity was other people’s problem, not mine. But they’ve captured the Supreme Court, and they’re using it to force their religion on the rest of us.

subs.text: So it’s no longer something that I can be neutral about. It seems that eventually, maybe very soon, we will come to hate Christianity.
subs.rawText: So it’s no longer something that I can be neutral about. It seems that eventually, maybe very soon, we will come to hate Christianity.
